alert.note: Alert for Butler; Ripley; Stoddard (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 22 at 4:58AM CST until February 22 at 5:30AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Ripley County in southeastern Missouri... South central Stoddard County in southeastern Missouri... Southern Butler County in southeastern Missouri... * Until 530 AM CST. * At 457 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Oxly to near Delaplaine to near Egypt, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Oxly around 500 AM CST. Naylor around 505 AM CST. Neelyville around 510 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Qulin. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for southeastern Missouri. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Paducah. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for southeastern Missouri.
